編輯程式碼，使其適用於這個關卡。"
long_instructions.courseF_bee_variables_4_2020:
"「讓我們繼續前進吧！」

編輯程式碼，使其適用於這個關卡。"
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables1a:
變數可用於存儲以後要用的文本。

將該文本分配給「shout」變數，讓足球運動員Kiki大喊「目標！」。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables2b:
將文本片段與變數混合在一起，可以使句子更有趣。

將變數「color」插入句子的中間部分，將其放入「join」積木的空槽位處。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables3b_josh: 用變數 `age` 取代固定的年齡 `12`，幫 Kiki 和 Brain 完成對話。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables4b:
現在，海盜Pegleg有一些問題要問Brian。

此程式碼使用了一個「ask」（詢問）積木，這樣，您就可以在點選「Run」後鍵入Brian的回答。

將變數放在正確的位置，以創建此次會話。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables5c:
讓我們將「ask」積木與「if/else」語句結合起來，來獲得一些樂趣！

海盜Pegleg要問您一個問題。將一份「answer」（回答）變數拖到「if」（如果）語句的條件句中，以檢查是否輸入了正確的顏色。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables6c:
在此階段的其餘部分，我們將使用多個「ask」積木和多個「if/else」語句來創建您可以控制的遊戲！

首先將「codename」（代號）變數設定為一個您可以記住的單詞。然後，使用「ask」積木從用戶處獲得一個代號。您將需要一個「if/else」積木，以查看輸入的代號是否與您設定的代號匹配。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables7b:
是時候製作自己的項目了！

創建一些問題並將答案編到您自己的故事中。

如果您需要創意，請點選提示圖標。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables7c:
添加另一個「ask」積木，要求用戶猜測顏色。

保持您的「if/else」語句，從而讓您的代號總是贏遊戲，但其他所有代號總是輸遊戲。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables8c: 透過將「codename」和「color」變數都加入響應中，使用「join」積木（在「Text」（文本）下的工具箱中）可以使贏/輸消息更加個人化。
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables_challenge1: 使用這些積木讓演員共享敲門笑話。更改笑話關鍵句和設定，以講自己的笑話！
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables_challenge2:
現在開始玩標記遊戲！標記貓（演員2）可獲得2分。標記企鵝（演員3）可獲得3分。獲得10分即可獲勝！

但是要小心，當貓和企鵝相互標記時，會扣掉分數。

* * *

添加使遊戲按照說明的方式運行所必需的積木。

-   如何使用箭頭鍵使狗朝各個方向移動？
-   當狗標記貓或企鵝時，如何添加分數？
-   當貓和企鵝接觸時，如何減去分數？
long_instructions.coursea_maze_ramp1_2018: 要讓小鳥抓到豬豬，把 <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> 積木連到 <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> 積木的底部，然後按「▶執行」！
long_instructions.coursea_maze_ramp1_2019: 要讓小鳥抓到豬豬，把 <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> 積木連到 <xml><block type="when_run" block-text="when run"/></xml> 積木的底部，然後按「▶執行」！
long_instructions.coursea_maze_ramp1_2020: 要讓小鳥抓到豬豬，把 <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> 積木連到 <xml><block type="when_run" block-text="when run"/></xml> 積木的底部，然後按「▶執行」！
long_instructions.frozen circle: 圓是一個特殊的形狀。您能想到中間的問號應該要選擇哪一個數字，才能畫出一個圓嗎？
long_instructions.frozen circle function: 使用新的「建立一個圓形」積木讓我建立 10 個相互重疊的圓形。不要忘了在每次畫一個圓之後向前跳。
long_instructions.frozen circle function in circle: 現在我們來建立 20 個互有重疊的圓，在每個圓之後轉向 18 度。
long_instructions.frozen circle function with parameter: 這裡有一個「建立一個圓形」的程式積木，可以畫出不同大小的圓。您可以用這個來建立一個大小為 5 的小圓，跟一個大小為 10 的較大的圓嗎？
long_instructions.frozen cross: 將這些指令放入「重複」積木裡來畫出一個加號。注意到了嗎？艾莎可以向後移動了。
long_instructions.frozen cross rotate: 現在試著重複 10 次吧。你覺得每次畫出線之後，需要轉向幾度呢？
long_instructions.frozen cross rotate dense: 現在我們來重複 90 次！要重複 90 次的話，每次要幾度才能轉到 360 度呢？提示：這是個非常小的數字。
long_instructions.frozen diamond: 將這些程式放到「重複」積木裡來畫出平行四邊形，它就像一個長方形，但角度不同。我們要畫的是有 60 度和 120 度角的四邊形，而長方形的所有角度都是 90 度。
long_instructions.frozen diamond mini snowflake: 你知道每個雪花的形狀都不同嗎？讓我們用另一個「重複」積木創造一個新的雪花，它是由 4 個重複的平行四邊形所組成，每畫完一個平行四邊形就向右轉 90 度。
long_instructions.frozen diamond snowflake: 現在，讓我們創建新的雪花圖案，通過使用「重複」積木來畫出平行四邊形 10 次，每畫一個之後轉向 36 度。
long_instructions.frozen freeplay: 您已經變成一個專業的藝術家囉！開始打造一個冬季仙境吧。
long_instructions.frozen perpendicular: 現在看看我們能不能畫出 2 條線，然後讓 2 條線成 90 度。除了「移動-向前」積木外，你還需要用到「轉向-右方」或「轉向-左方」的積木喔。
long_instructions.frozen snowflake branch: 用用看「建立雪花分支」積木，建立 3 個分支，讓它一開始像個雪花。
long_instructions.frozen snowflake full: 現在我們來重複它 8 次以製作出美麗的雪花！
long_instructions.frozen snowflower: 精細複雜的雪花樣式其實可以用非常簡單的形狀來產生。您可以畫重複五個大小為 5 的圓，以及五個大小為 10 個圓嗎？
long_instructions.frozen square iterative: 看來我們已經畫出了正方形的一半了！來，我們一起把 4 條線組合起來，變成一個正方形吧！
long_instructions.frozen square loop: 嗨，我是艾倫戴爾的安娜公主！讓我們用「重複」積木畫個正方形，這樣一來我們就可以用較少的積木完成。你覺得要「重複」幾次（???）才能畫出一個正方形呢？
long_instructions.frozen square loop 3x: 這次我們來建立 3 個正方形吧！每個正方形完成後，記得要轉 120 度，再畫下一個正方形。
long_instructions.frozen square snowflake: 你可以用「重複」積木來畫 10 次正方形，每次轉 36 度嗎？這樣可以繪製出一個雪花喔！

long_instructions.iceage_click_hello:
你可以在點擊 喜德 時，幫助他呼叫朋友嗎？
完成後，請按「運行」來進行遊戲。點擊 喜德 看看你的程式有沒有順利運作！
long_instructions.iceage_free_play:
是時候創造自己的遊戲或故事了！

完成之後可以點擊「完成」按鈕，讓朋友在手機、平板電腦或電腦上玩你的遊戲！
不知道該怎麼做嗎？點擊提示來獲取詳細資訊。
long_instructions.iceage_hello1: 喜德（角色 1）希望找更多人來一起冒險。你能將`角色說出`積木拖曳出來，並且連接到`當運行時`積木的下方，幫助喜德說「你好！」嗎？
long_instructions.iceage_hello2: 蠻尼（角色 2）找到了喜德（角色 1），並想邀請他加入冒險。使用兩次`角色__說`積木來幫助他們互相打招呼。
long_instructions.iceage_move_events:
Scrat 還在持續尋找橡果！
在每個事件上添加一個`移動角色 1`積木，並更改成對應方向的方向鍵，來幫助他四處走動。
完成後，點擊「運行」，然後嘗試收集所有橡果。
long_instructions.iceage_move_to_actor: 狄亞哥（角色 1）正在找尋 蠻尼（角色 2）。你能幫忙兩個人碰面嗎？將一個積木連接到`當角色碰到`事件積木的下方，在他們發現彼此時播放聲音。
long_instructions.iceage_move_to_flag: Scrat 正在尋找他的橡果！你能幫他移動最後的 200 像素嗎？
long_instructions.iceage_repeat: `重複無限次` 積木可以讓你不斷執行程式。你能將程式積木附加到裡頭，讓葛瑞妮不斷地左右移動，以幫助她鍛鍊一下筋骨嗎？
long_instructions.iceage_sound_and_points:
這是你上一個關卡的程式，以及左右移動 阿嬤 的程式。
你能完成程式來讓 喜德 和 阿嬤 在發生碰撞時，**播放聲音**並且**得分**嗎？
點擊「運行」按鈕來開始遊戲。
long_instructions.iceage_throw_hearts:
喜德想要讓他的阿嬤知道他很愛她。

使用`角色_投擲`指令來使 喜德（角色 1）向 阿嬤（角色 2）投擲愛心，讓 阿嬤 在收到愛心的時候心情變愉快。
long_instructions.iceage_warn_ice_age:
每個人都需要加緊腳步，因為一場冰風暴即將來臨！
將場景更改為冰天雪地，並將 喜德（角色 1）的速度設定為快速。
點擊「運行」按鈕，將 喜德 移動到 狄亞哥 的位置來警告牠。

向前移動60畫素，幫助小藝術家在冬天來臨之前蓋住他的鮮花。

"# 修改和預測

選擇一個控制這個模擬的變數進行修改，並預測它將如何改變結果。

-   河馬收集了多少個蘋果？
-   所有的蘋果都收集到一共花了多少時間？"

long_instructions.Crack a Caesar Cipher: # 破解凱薩的加密方法吧！ 這個工具可以讓您可以利用英文字母的變換來進行凱薩加密方法。您可以利用這項工具對訊息文字進行加密以及解密的練習。 # 這樣子做 - 從下拉式訊息選單中，選取並讀取出**範例訊息**。這則範例訊息是經過凱薩加密方法處理過後的訊息。 ![](https://images.code.org/347139486c8c729bf3c6e72ce67da878-image-1476286380409.gif) - 利用位於凱薩替換的標籤頁中的按鈕，您可以透過將英文字母向前平移或是向後平移的方式，來嘗試解讀這些訊息文字。 ![](https://images.code.org/ef9ebc16d2f1442dc46fba9bd48b5d43-image-1476285966821.gif) 看看您需要花多久的時間來破解這些凱薩加密方法！同時，您覺得這是個加密機密資料的好方法嗎？
long_instructions.Crack Random Substitution: # 破解一個隨機替換加密方法吧！ 工具這一次給你更多關於密文的資訊，以及更多選項讓你嘗試不同種類的替換方式。 ### 分析文字的不同方式 - 利用在隨機替換加密法標籤中提供的一些排序選項，嘗試以不同的視角來檢視輸入文本以及標準英文文本的字母出現頻率 ![](https://images.code.org/82efbca1807206c9a07de520fdb22027-image-1443572614493.23.28.png) ### 不同的替換方式 - 如果要替換字母的話，你可以直接在想要改變原本密文中的橘色字母下方的藍色字母，將它拖拉到你想要的位置。 ![](https://images.code.org/da9a7af7568d8c1698872ab91b4d79d7-image-1443572471212.gif) ### 嘗試。一直嘗試。 - 當然有其他可以用來分析並替換字母的方式。你可以點擊這些按鈕並思考一下哪種方式是你喜歡的替換方式。 - 記住並放心：你不用擔心把這些按鈕玩壞的：） 來看看你花了多久的時間來破解這次的加密方法！思考一下這是不是一個不錯的加密文字的方法呢？
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - Change Text 2: **目標：** 把文字變大，並且變成藍色的 :) **如何辦到呢：** 你將需要二行程式碼。將 `"label1"` 的 `"font-size"` 設成 `80` 以及 `"text-color"` 設成 `"blue"`. **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/2d5d46a03082af3b01847aad6602e2ea-image-1511280140482.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - Full Text: **目標：** 把按鈕的顏色分別變成紅色與藍色。接著在大的橘色方格中，改變它的文字 **如何辦到呢：** - 記得你可以用滑鼠指著圖示，以看到他們的 `"id"`。 - 將按鈕的背景顏色 `"background-color" 設定成紅色`"red"`與藍色`"blue"\` - 將橘色方格的文字屬性 `"text"` 設定成任何你想要的內容，例如 `"歡迎來到我的app！"` **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/4bf99e7352e7c17a5bf73ced80171f6a-image-1511280628092.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - onEvent intro: **目標：** 這個畫面一開始會是藍色。加一些程式碼，讓你點選「變綠色」 "Green-ify" 的按鈕時，畫面會變成綠色的 **如何辦到呢：** 在 `onEvent()` 當中寫個程式，會將畫面的背景顏色 `"background-color"` 設定成綠色 `"green"` **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/5ddf6b129bc04b79839b3661ccef788b-image-1511281012076.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - onEvent twoButtons: **目標：** 幫助完成閃光燈的app。「開啟」 "On" 按鈕會將畫面變成白色。試著執行app看看。接著寫個程式，讓關閉 "Off" 按鈕能將畫面變成黑色 **如何辦到呢：** 在 `onEvent` 中寫程式，把畫面中的背景顏色 `"background-color"` 設成黑色 `"black"` ， 並且將標籤中的文字顏色 `"text-color"` 設成白色 `"white"` **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/020b1d9b465aaf35967a528a92961c13-image-1511281772276.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - playSound: **目標：** 這個音板要完成了！執行一下，了解它是怎麼運作的。接著在最後一個按鈕上加上圖片、文字和音樂 **如何辦到呢：** - 在程式中加上 `onEvent()` ，並且設定按鈕4 `"button4"` 的 "id" 。拖曳一個 `playSound()` 到 `onEvent()` 當中，並且從音樂庫裡面選擇一個音樂 - 在程式中加上 `setProperty()` （在 `onEvent()` 外面）以改變按鈕的圖片 `"image"` 屬性。在第三個下拉式選單中，選擇一張照片 - 再加一個 `setProperty()` 去改變按鈕的文字 `"text"` **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/a3fdcb8954c5e8d585bef64df1ec5b1a-image-1511285408512.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - thisOrThatAddButton: **目標：** 在畫面上加上第二個按鈕，寫著 "Right!"，而按鈕的 `"id"` 是 `"rightButton"` **如何辦到呢：** 在設計模式中，拉一個新按鈕進來，並且調整位置和大小。接著設定它的編號 `"id"`、文字 `"text"`、背景顏色 `"bachgroun color"` 以及文字大小 `"font size"` **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/7035ad0445984cf889b159cf5682e35a-image-1508383186447.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - thisOrThatAddScreen: **目標：** 建立一個新的畫面，叫做 `"rightScreen"`。並且加上一個文字標籤，叫做「你跑到右邊了！」 “You went right!" **如何辦到呢：** 在設計模式中，將一個新的畫面物件拉進來，把他的 `"id"` 改成 `"rightScreen"`。接著把文字標籤拉近畫面中，並且把他的文字改成 "You went right!" **有卡住的地方嗎？點這邊看說明** ![expandable](https://images.code.org/11cf186acb0453cf9ec46929b763f568-image-1508383646159.gif)
long_instructions.AppLab Intro 7 - thisOrThatPersonalize:
**目標：** 透過擴增這個專案，建立你自己的app。並且與其他人「分享」吧！ **如何辦到呢：** 確定你對建立哪種app有興趣，接著透過增加更多畫面、按鈕、文字、聲音以及使用者介面等，來創造出你的app。在工具箱（toolbox）中有更多不同的區塊，你也可以實驗看看。一但完成後，點選「分享」，把這個app發送給你自己或你的朋友！
點子：選出屬於你自己的探險 試試這個：範例：選擇你自己的探險app，你可以看它怎麼運作的。這邊有一些點子，可以幫助你想出屬於你自己的冒險故事。
  • 創造一個冒險，關於你最愛的真實或虛構的角色
  • 創造一個冒險，訴說著你最愛的書、電影的故事，或者自創的故事
  • 創造一個冒險，包含著許多未預期的曲折，或者困難的道德選擇。

    • 點子：祝賀卡 試試看這個 範例：祝賀卡app 你可以看看它如何運作。這邊有些想法，幫助你想出屬於你自己的問候卡。
  • 想一個即將到來的生日、節慶或特別的日子，做一張卡片來祝賀這個節日吧！
  • 給某個你很感激的人做一個感謝卡吧！
  • 為即將到來的活動，做一張邀請卡

    • 點子：人格測驗 試試看這個 範例：人格測驗app 你可以看看它如何運作。這邊有些想法，幫助你想出屬於你自己的人格測驗。
  • 建立一個測驗，當中會推論一個人可能喜歡的東西，例如一個餐點、一支隊伍、一本書或者一個地方
  • 建立一個測驗，依據他們喜歡的東西來「預測未來」
  • 建立一個測驗，協助大家做出一項困難的決定

long_instructions.CSD U2 Debugging 1_2019:
# Debugging
::: details [**What is a bug?**] Bugs are mistakes in code which causes it not to work as planned. ::: ::: details [**What is debugging?**] Debugging is the process of finding and fixing bugs. Debugging is a problem solving process so use your problem solving steps as you try to debug. ::: ::: details [**What are some examples of bugs?**] Bugs can be anything that causes code not to work as planned. Some examples are misspelling, putting code in the wrong place, using the wrong tag, or forgetting to close a tag. :::
Computer code is written by humans, and all humans make mistakes. Part of being a good computer scientist is finding your mistakes and fixing them. In computer science we call mistakes **bugs**. The process of finding and fixing those bugs is called **debugging**. Over the next couple levels you are going to work on your debugging skills. # Do This - Look at the web page code, and discuss with your partner what is causing the following two bugs: - The heading is not big enough. - The second item on the list doesn't have a number. - Fix all the bugs in the code so that the final result matches the image on the right.

Debugging is a problem solving process so use your problem solving steps as you try to debug. ::: ::: details [**What are some examples of bugs?**] Bugs can be anything that causes code not to work as planned. Some examples are misspelling, putting code in the wrong place, using the wrong tag, or forgetting to close a tag. ::: ::: details [**Why does the inspector sometimes stop working?**] Sometimes there are so many bugs in the HTML that the inspector cannot read the code properly and it stops working completely, even on the parts of the code that are correct. Once the bugs are corrected, the inspector will work again. :::

long_instructions.CSD U2 Debugging 4_2019:
# Formatting
::: details [**What is whitespace?**] Whitespace refers to any character that shows up as a blank space on the screen, such as a space, a tab, or a new line. Whitespace helps separate different parts of the document to make it easier to read. For example, in HTML code new elements are usually put on a new line, even though it doesn't make any difference in how the page is displayed. ::: ::: details [**What is indentation?**] Indentation is the placement of text farther to the right, or left, to separate it from surrounding text. Indentation helps to convey the program's structure. In HTML, elements that are inside other elements are usually indented. Here is an example:

This paragraph is inside the "body" element.

::: ::: details [**What is formatting?**] Formatting is arranging text in a way that makes it easier to understand. HTML is usually formatted using indentation. That means that elements that are inside other elements are further to the right in code. Here is an example:

This paragraph is inside the "body" element.

::: ::: details [**Why does the inspector sometimes stop working?**] Sometimes there are so many bugs in the HTML that the inspector cannot read the code properly and it stops working completely, even on the parts of the code that are correct. Once the bugs are corrected, the inspector will work again. :::
The way that you write your code can make it easier or harder to find bugs. If you use **whitespace** and **indentation**, it will make it easier to read and easier to fix. # Do This - Look at the code with your partner and discuss how you should format the code to make it easier to read. - Make the code easier to read by adding new lines and indentation. - Fix all the bugs so that your page matches the target page below. ![]()

當開始任何一個 Web Lab 專案時，會自動添加 `<!DOCTYPE>`, `<html>`, `<head>` 和 `<body>` 標籤到專案中。當在專案中新增內容時，你需要將內容放置於 `<body>` 和 `</body>` 標籤之間，因為內容應該是網頁 body 中的一部分。

# 做以下

-   在你的網頁中的 body 標籤內，寫下三句不同任意主題的句子。
-   若沒有在預覽頁面上看到變動，請點擊 "更新和保存"。
-   和同學比較一下你的實作。確認你們的內容程式碼是放在一樣的地方。

`）和結束（`

`）標籤標記。HTML中的段落可以是任何長度的文字，從一個單詞到一堆句子。段落將句子組合在一起，並在該組文字和下一組文字之間放置一些空格。 ::: ::: 細節 [**為什麼即使HTML損壞了，HTML似乎也能正常工作？**] Web瀏覽器讀取HTML，以生成網頁。由於人們在編寫網頁時經常犯的小錯誤，因此對瀏覽器進行了程式修改，可以最好的猜測您的意圖。有時甚至對不同的瀏覽器進行編程以做出不同的猜測！確保代碼看起來像預期的方法，確保始終正確使用標籤。 ::: ::: 細節 [**為什麼代碼有時變成粉紅色?**] Web Lab平台程式會自動檢測HTML中的某些錯誤。當發現錯誤時，它將代碼變成粉紅色。錯誤可能是粉紅色的，也可能是粉紅色代碼之前的某處。您需要仔細除錯才能發現錯誤。 :::
# 除錯：修復損壞的標籤 這個基本的網頁存在一些問題，無法正確顯示內容。確定並解決問題。這種做法也稱為'除錯'您的代碼。 # 做這個 - 修復損壞的代碼，使網頁能正確顯示 - 與夥伴比較您解決的問題
long_instructions.CSD U2 Heading Demo_2019:
# Headings
::: details [**What are headings?**] Headings are the different sized section titles throughout a web page. Headings add structure to your web page by breaking it up so it's easier for a user to read. ::: ::: details [**How do I make different sized headings?**] Headings come in 6 different sizes. So far you have primarily used the biggest one: `

`. The number '1' in the HTML tag designates that this is the biggest heading. The smallest heading is `

`. You can also try the `

`, `

`, `

`, and `

` tags, which get smaller as the number gets larger. ::: ::: details [**What is HTML?**] HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language. HTML is used to add structure to the content of a web page. HTML uses tags to specify where certain structures start and end. These tags are sets of characters not found in the English language so that the content and structure can be differentiated. ::: ::: details [**What is an HTML element?**] An HTML element is a piece of a website that is marked by a start tag and sometimes closed with an end tag. The element also includes the content inside the tags. For example: ::: ::: details [**What is an HTML tag?**] An HTML tag is the special set of characters that tells the machine where the start or end of an HTML element is and what type it is. :::
So far, you've organized your content into paragraphs. Another way HTML allows you to organize your code is by using **headings**. A heading is a short piece of text that goes at the top of a section of content, like a title. # Do This: - Find the headings in the web page below and use the Inspector Tool to see the code that makes them. - Make sure you and your partner agree on what the tags do. - Change the code so that "Drawing" and "2 years" match the headings on the rest of the page.
long_instructions.CSD U2 Heading Sizes_2018:
# 標題大小
**標題是什麼？** 標題是指網頁中不同大小的文章區塊中的標題。 透過標題讓網頁內容結構化易於閱讀。
**該如何產生不同大小的標題?** 標題有 6 種不同大小。 最常見的標題是 <h1> HTML標籤中的數字 1 代表它是大小最大的標題。最小的標題是 <h6>. 你也可以嘗試 <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, 和 <h5> 標籤上數字越大，呈現文字大小越小。
**What is HTML?** HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language. HTML is used to add structure to the content of a web page. HTML uses tags to specify where certain structures start and end. These tags are sets of characters not found in the English language so that the content and structure can be differentiated.
**What is an HTML element?** An HTML element is a piece of a website that is marked by a start tag and sometimes closed with an end tag. The element also includes the content inside the tags. For example:
**What is an HTML tag?** An HTML tag is the special set of characters that tells the machine where the start or end of an HTML element is and what type it is.
Headings can come in different sizes. In this page, there are six different sized headings, but they are all mixed up. Can you and your partner figure out how to fix them? Do This: - Use the inspector tool to figure out what makes the headings different sizes - Make sure you and your partner agree on what the different heading tags do. - Change the tags so that the headings are in order from biggest to smallest, and the text says the correct size, as in the picture below.

long_instructions.CSD U2 Image Tag 1_2019:
::: details [**How do I add images?**] The `` tag allows you to show images on your web page.

Example: In order to tell the browser which file to use, extra information, called an **attribute**, is added to the tag inside the brackets. The attribute `src` stands for **s**ou**rc**e and tell the name of the image. Image files names include extensions which tell the computer which type of image they are working with. Common extensions are .jpg, .jpeg, .png.

In addition to have the src attribute, image elements also have the `alt` attribute which describe the image. This is important in case the image doesn’t load or for people who have trouble with their eyesight.

An `` tag is an example of a **self-closing tag** because it starts and closes in one tag. ::: ::: details [**Why does an image tag not have a closing tag?**] An image tag doesn't need a closing tag because there is no text content which must be wrapped in tags. The content that shows on the screen is specified through the tags attributes. ::: ::: details [**What is an attribute?**] Attributes are extra information included in a tag. Attributes have names and values. The name tells what type of information is being provided and then the value gives the specific information for that tag. For example `` tags have two attributes, src and alt. src specifies the name of the image file and alt tells the browser in readable text what the image is. :::
# Images A Dog vs Cat web page has been started for you. The dog image has already been added to the below web page. Look at the code that made the dog image appear, then use an image tag to add the `cat.jpeg` image to the page below the cat heading. This image was found at pixabay and was uploaded by the user "Alexas\_Fotos", who used a "free for commercial use" and "no attribution required" license.
long_instructions.CSD U2 Image Tag 2_2019:
::: details [**How do I add images?**] The `` tag allows you to show images on your web page. Example: In order to tell the browser which file to use, extra information, called an **attribute**, is added to the tag inside the brackets. The attribute `src` stands for **s**ou**rc**e and tell the name of the image. Image files names include extensions which tell the computer which type of image they are working with. Common extensions are .jpg, .jpeg, .png.

In addition to have the src attribute, image elements also have the `alt` attribute which describe the image. This is important in case the image doesn’t load or for people who have trouble with their eyesight.

An `` tag is an example of a **self-closing tag** because it starts and closes in one tag. ::: ::: details [**Why does an image tag not have a closing tag?**] An image tag doesn't need a closing tag because there is no text content which must be wrapped in tags. The content that shows on the screen is specified through the tags attributes. ::: ::: details [**What is an attribute?**] Attributes are extra information included in a tag. Attributes have names and values. The name tells what type of information is being provided and then the value gives the specific information for that tag. For example `` tags have two attributes, src and alt. src specifies the name of the image file and alt tells the browser in readable text what the image is. :::
# Uploading Images You can upload images that you've found elsewhere using the **Add Image** button. Go find an image of a different type of pet that you like and download it to your computer (using right-click "Save As"). Once you have your images, click ![]() and upload the image from your computer into your project, where you can then use it in your page. # Do This - Upload at least one image into this web page - Use the `` tag to display the image(s) in your website. - Make sure to add an `alt` attribute.

# Giving Credit When using a Creative Commons licensed image, you need to give credit to the original creator (this is also called _attribution_). There are lots of ways to provide attribution, but the easiest way is to add text below the image that identifies the creator and website it came from. # Do This In this page we've already added and attributed an image of a frog. Use the Creative Commons search engine to find another image of an amphibian. Add your found image to this page, along with proper attribution, including: - The name of the creator (if available) - The website it was found on (e.g. commons.wikimedia.org) - The license it was published under (e.g. CC-BY)

# The Details Matter The `src` attribute needs to point to the _exact_ filename of the image you want to use. That means you need to pay attention to spelling, capitalization, and the file extension. Each of the three images on this page is broken because of an improper `src` attribute. Using the file menu for reference, fix each of the image tags. _Note: Even though the images are not loading properly, our website is still showing descriptive text of what should be there because we used `alt` attributes. Cool!_

我要如何使用檢視工具? 檢視工具是一個能夠更加了解 Web Lab 裡面不熟悉程式碼的一個好方法。如果想要打開檢視工具按下 。當你看到按鈕變成白色而且顯示「檢視工具: 開啟」，那就表示檢視工具已經打開了。當你打開檢視工具之後，你可以移動你的游標到預覽區域的任何地方，然後網頁實驗室就會把造成那一個區塊的網頁顯示出來的程式碼重點標示出來。

long_instructions.CSD U2 add file_2019:
::: details [**What is a style sheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. ::: ::: details [**How do I create a new style sheet?**] To create a new style sheet, click on the "Add CSS" button above the code area. ::: ::: details [**What should I name my style sheet?**] You can name your style sheet anything, but it's better to choose a relevant name, such as "style.css" or "aboutmestyles.css" so that it's clear what the file is. Your file should always end in the ".css" extension. ::: ::: details [**How do I rename a file?**] To rename a file, you can right click (or control click) on the file name and choose the "Rename" option. This will allow you to type in a new file name. Clicking on a file name after it is already highlighted will also allow you to rename the file. ::: ::: details [**How do I add a style sheet to a web page?**] To add a style sheet to a web page, open up the code for the web page. Inside the head tag, add the following code ``. Then change "style.css" to the name of your style sheet. :::
# Adding a Style Sheet This is your project from before. In the next level, you'll have a chance to add some different styles to it, but first, you need to add a style sheet, name it, and link it to your html page. 1. Create a new style sheet for your project. 2. Rename the style sheet file. 3. Add your style sheet to your HTML page.

Now that you've seen some different ways to style, it's time to try it out yourself.  Here's a web page you've seen before, but it needs some style!

-   Make all of the text a different color.
-   Add any other styles you want.
long_instructions.CSD U2 classes modify_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] For the code to work, you need to both create a winter class and add elements to the class. The class is created in the style sheet, with the following code. .winter { color: rgb(195,230,255); } This code creates a class called `winter` and makes everything in the class our winter blue, which has the RGB values of (195,230,255). The code that adds a `h5` element to the winter class is `
`. The `class=winter` inside the opening tag adds everything inside the tag to the class. ::: ::: details [**What rules can be added to a class rule-set?**] A class rule-set can have the same rules as any other type of selector. If a rule does not apply to the content of the class (for example, using `font-size` on an element with no text), then the computer will ignore that rule, but still use the rules that work. ::: ::: details [**Why does the selector have a period in front of it?**] In CSS, a period in front of a selector means that the selector is the name of a class. If there is no period, it means that the selector is the name of an HTML tag. ::: ::: details [**Why would a web developer use classes?**] A web developer uses classes when some elements should be styled differently than others, even if they are the same tag. Classes can also be used to give elements that have different tags the same style. ::: ::: details [**I got different RGB values, but mine are right, too.**] Because RGB creates millions of different colors, some are so similar that people have a hard time telling them apart. That means that there are multiple RGB values that are close enough to work for our winter color. :::
# Adding Rules Your winter words should all have the same color and font. - Find the CSS rule-set in the style sheet that gives the winter words their style. - Add a rule that changes the font of the winter words. It can be any font, but it will need to be different from that of the other three seasons. - Add any other rules you'd like for your winter words.

Why is "snowy" the only winter word without the winter color? - Add code to the HTML that will give "snowy" the same winter blue as the other words. - Look inside the style sheet to find the rule that makes all the words in the winter class blue, and check whether your RGB numbers are close to the ones in the style sheet. - Discuss with your partner how the code works.
long_instructions.CSD U2 classes spring_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] For the code to work, you need to both create a spring class and add elements to the class. The spring class is already created in the style sheet, but it doesn't have any rules. .spring { color: rgb(195,230,255); } Look at the rules in the `winter` class for clues to how to make rules for the summer class. You will also need to add some elements to the spring class inside your HTML file. The code in the HTML file that adds a `h5` element to the winter class is `
`. Use this pattern to add elements to the spring class, too. ::: ::: details [**What rules can be added to a class rule-set?**] A class rule-set can have the same rules as any other type of selector. If a rule does not apply to the content of the class (for example, using `font-size` on an element with no text), then the computer will ignore that rule, but still use the rules that work. ::: ::: details [**Why does the selector have a period in front of it?**] In CSS, a period in front of a selector means that the selector is the name of a class. If there is no period, it means that the selector is the name of an HTML tag. ::: ::: details [**Why would a web developer use classes?**] A web developer uses classes when some elements should be styled differently than others, even if they are the same tag. Classes can also be used to give elements that have different tags the same style. :::
# Spring Class Now that your winter class is ready, you can start on the other seasons. - Find the empty CSS rule-set in the style sheet that gives the spring words their style. - Add two rules, one to give the text your spring color for earlier in the lesson, and another to give the text a different font, font size, or decoration. - Add the spring class to the spring elements in the HTML page.
long_instructions.CSD U2 classes summer_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] For the code for the winter class to work, it needs to both create a winter class and add elements to the class. The class is created in the style sheet, with the following code. .winter { color: rgb(195,230,255); } This code creates a class called `winter` and makes everything in the class our winter blue, which has the RGB values of (195,230,255). The code that adds a `h5` element to the winter class is `
`. The `class=winter` inside the opening tag adds everything inside the tag to the class. ::: ::: details [**How do I create a new rule-set?**] You can create a new rule-set by following the pattern that the `winter` and `spring` classes used in the style sheet. .winter { color: rgb(195,230,255); } The selector name and the color values will be different, but the following pattern is always the same. .classname { property1: value1; property2: value2; } ::: ::: details [**Why does the selector have a period in front of it?**] In CSS, a period in front of a selector means that the selector is the name of a class. If there is no period, it means that the selector is the name of an HTML tag. ::: ::: details [**Why would a web developer use classes?**] A web developer uses classes when some elements should be styled differently than others, even if they are the same tag. Classes can also be used to give elements that have different tags the same style. :::
# Summer and Autumn Classes - Inside the style sheet, create a new rule-set for a "summer" class. - Add a rule to set the text in the summer class to your summer RGB color. - Add the summer class to the summer elements in the HTML page. - Do the same for the autumn class.
long_instructions.CSD U2 commenting_2019:
# Comments
::: details [**What is whitespace?**] Whitespace refers to any character that shows up as a blank space on the screen, such as a space, a tab, or a new line. Whitespace helps separate different parts of the document to make it easier to read. For example, in HTML code new elements are usually put on a new line, even though it doesn't make any difference in how the page is displayed. ::: ::: details [**What is indentation?**] Indentation is the placement of text farther to the right, or left, to separate it from surrounding text. Indentation helps to convey the program's structure. In HTML, elements that are inside other elements are usually indented. Here is an example:

This paragraph is inside the "body" element.

::: ::: details [**What is formatting?**] Formatting is arranging text in a way that makes it easier to understand. HTML is usually formatted using indentation. That means that elements that are inside other elements are further to the right in code. Here is an example:

This paragraph is inside the "body" element.

:::
You can add **comments** to your code to explain the different parts of the code and what it should create. Comments can help you to debug, and will also help other people who are trying to understand your code. # Do This - Look at the code with your partner and find the comments. - Use the comments to help you fix the bugs in the HTML.

long_instructions.CSD U2 layout style bgcolor_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that is making the background of the page blue: body { background-color: lightblue; } - `body` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces, in this case, the body element is the entire page. - `background-color: lightblue;` is the rule that makes the entire page light blue. - `background-color` is the _property_. It explains what the rule is about, in this case the color of the background. - `lightblue` is the _value_. It explains how the rule should be applied, in this case making the background light blue. ::: ::: details [**What colors can I use in CSS?**] CSS includes most common color names (red, blue, green, etc.), and many uncommon ones. You can see a full list of CSS color names at W3Schools - HTML Color Names. You can still use colors that are not included in the named list, but you will need to use their RGB values. You can read more about using colors in CSS at W3Schools - CSS Legal Color Values ::: ::: details [**What does the background-color property do?**] The `background-color` property determines the color of the background of an element. You can read more about the property at W3Schools - CSS background-color Property ::: ::: details [**What if an element inside the page has a different background color from the body?**] You can see the answer to this question by adding a `background-color` rule to the `p` tag. The paragraphs will have the background color in the rule for the `p` tag, and the rest of the page will follow the rule for the `body` tag. ::: ::: details [**What is a style sheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; } In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# Background Color - Find the code in the style sheet that is making the background of the entire page light blue. - Change the code to make the page a different color. - Try to change the background color of just the paragraphs.
long_instructions.CSD U2 layout style body_2019:
::: details [**What does the body selector do?**] Because the content of the web page is all inside the `body` tag, the body selector gives style rules for everything on the web page. ::: ::: details [**What does the color property do?**] The `color` property specifies the color of the text. If there’s no text, it won’t do anything. Read more at W3Schools - CSS color Property ::: ::: details [**What does the text-align property do?**] The `text-align` property aligns the text to the left, right, or center. You can read more at W3Schools - CSS text-align Property ::: ::: details [**What does the text-decoration property do?**] The `text-decoration` property puts a line over, under, or through a piece of text. You can read more about the property at W3Schools - CSS text-decoration Property ::: ::: details [**What does the font-family property do?**] The `font-family` property changes the font of the text. It gives a general description of the type of font that should be used, but each browser might display the font slightly differently. Read more at W3chools - CSS font-family Property ::: ::: details [**What does the font-size property do?**] The `font-size` property changes the size of the text. You can use general terms, such as `small`, `medium`, and `large`, or you can specify the exact size in pixels, such as `20px`. Read more at W3Schools - CSS font-size Property ::: ::: details [**What is a stylesheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; } In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# The Body Element - Find the `body` rule-set in the style sheet. - Discuss with a partner what you think will happen if you add `text-align`, `color`, or other text properties to the `body` rule set. - Try out some different properties to check your guesses.
long_instructions.CSD U2 layout style border_2019:
::: details [**What colors can I use in CSS?**] CSS includes most common color names (red, blue, green, etc.), and many uncommon ones. You can see a full list of CSS color names at W3Schools - HTML Color Names. You can still use colors that are not included in the named list, but you will need to use their RGB values. You can read more about using colors in CSS at W3Schools - CSS Legal Color Values ::: ::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that is making the image borders: img { border-color: saddlebrown; border-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-radius: 10px; } - `img` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces, in this case, the images. - `border-color: saddlebrown;`,`border-width: 4px;`,`border-style: solid;`, and `border-radius: 10px;` are the rules that make the border. ::: ::: details [**What does the border-style property do?**] The `border-style` property determines what kind of border (solid, dotted, etc.) the element has. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS border-style Property ::: ::: details [**What does the border-radius property do?**] The `border-radius` property determines the radius of the curves at the corners of the element. A bigger radius makes a bigger, softer curve, and a smaller radius makes a smaller, sharper curve. A radius of zero makes a regular corner. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS3 border-radius property ::: ::: details [**What does the `float` property do?**] The `float` property makes an element "float", meaning that the elements that come after it all flow around it. If the `float` value is `left`, the element will float to the left, and the elements after it will show up on its right. If the `float` value is `right`, the element will float to the right, and the elements after it will show up on its left. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS float Property :::
# Borders - Find the rules in the style sheet that set image borders color and width. - Change the color and width of your borders. - Try out some different border styles. - Choose from `dotted`, `dashed`, `solid`, and `double` - Put a border on another type of page element, such as one of the headings or the paragraphs.

A bigger radius makes a bigger, softer curve, and a smaller radius makes a smaller, sharper curve. A radius of zero makes a regular corner. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS3 border-radius property ::: ::: details [**What does the float property do?**] The `float` property makes an element "float", meaning that the elements that come after it all flow around it. If the `float` value is `left`, the element will float to the left, and the elements after it will show up on its right. If the `float` value is `right`, the element will float to the right, and the elements after it will show up on its left. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS float Property :::
# Border Radius - Look at the `border-radius` property inside your `img` rule-set - Discuss with your partner what you think the property does. - Try different values for border radius and decide which one you like the best.

It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces, in this case, the images. - `margin: 10px;` is the rule that puts 10 pixels of space around the image. ::: ::: details [**What does the `margin` property do?**] The `margin` property determines how much space will be around the image. Most of the time, you will define in the margin in pixels. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS margin Property ::: ::: details [**What does `px` mean / What is a pixel?**] Pixel, which is abbreviated `px`, is how elements are measured in CSS. It’s the size of a single point of light on the screen. :::
# Margin Margins specify how much space should be around an element. - Find the `margin` property in the `img` rule-set. - Change the margin to be larger, and discuss the effect with a partner. - Choose another element type and give it a margin, too.
long_instructions.CSD U2 layout style sample_2019:
::: details [**What does the body selector do?**] Because the content of the web page is all inside the `body` tag, the body selector gives style rules for everything on the web page. ::: ::: details [**What does the border-style property do?**] The `border-style` property determines what kind of border (solid, dotted, dashed, etc.) the element has. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS border-style Property ::: ::: details [**What does the border-radius property do?**] The `border-radius` property determines the radius of the curves at the corners of the element. A bigger radius makes a bigger, softer curve, and a smaller radius makes a smaller, sharper curve. A radius of zero makes a regular corner. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS3 border-radius property ::: ::: details [**What does the float property do?**] The `float` property makes an element "float", meaning that the elements that come after it all flow around it. If the `float` value is `left`, the element will float to the left, and the elements after it will show up on its right. If the `float` value is `right`, the element will float to the right, and the elements after it will show up on its left. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS float Property :::
# Layout and Style - Look through web page below for new styles. - Open the style sheet - With your partner, discuss which parts of the CSS code you think are making the page appear different. - What makes the entire page blue? - How are the images positioned to the left of all the other elements? - What made the image corners rounded? In the next few levels, you'll be changing and adding new styles on this page.
long_instructions.CSD U2 layout style width_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that is making the image its current size: img { width: 250px; } - `img` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces, in this case, the images. - `width: 250px` is the rule that makes the image 250 pixels wide. It also changes the height so that the image does not stretch. ::: ::: details [**What does the `width` property do?**] The `width` property determines how wide the element will be. Most of the time, you will define the width in pixels, which makes the element take up an exact amount of space on the screen. Defining the width will also change the height so that the image does not stretch, unless you have also defined the height. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS width Property ::: ::: details [**What does the `height` property do?**] The `height` property determines how tall the element will be. Most of the time, you will define the height in pixels, which makes the element take up an exact amount of space on the screen. Defining the height will also change the width so that the image does not stretch, unless you have also defined the width. You can read more about this property at W3Schools - CSS height Property ::: ::: details [**What does `px` mean / What is a pixel?**] Pixel, which is abbreviated `px`, is how elements are measured in CSS. It’s the size of a single point of light on the screen. ::: ::: details [**Why does using a width and height rule at the same time sometimes stretch out the image?**] When the width of an images changes, the height must change by the same percentage, otherwise the image will stretch. For example, if you double the width of an image, you must also double the height, or the image will be stretched horizonally. When you only define the width or the height, the computer will automatically change the other property so that the image looks the same. :::
# Width and Height - Find the property in the style sheet that controls the width of the images. - Change the width of the images to be larger or smaller. - Create a new rule with a `height` property to control the height of the images. - Use the `width` property in the `p` rule-set to change the width of your paragraphs.

`. This is an abbreviation for Unordered List. Each item in the list is marked by a list item element `
    • `. This is an abbreviation for List Item.     • `. This is an abbreviation for List Item. The list item element is a child element, which means that it goes inside of its parent element, the ordered list. ::: ::: details [**How do I make an ordered list?**] Making an ordered list has two steps: making the list and adding the list items. To make the ordered list, write the ordered list tags `
    `. Next, add your list items **inside** the ordered list tags. To make each list item, use the list item tags `

    ` tags. :::
    You can also use HTML to make different types of lists on your web page. This recipe includes two different types of lists, one ordered (with numbers) and one unordered (with bullets). # Do This - Use the inspector tool to see the code that is making the two different kinds of lists. - Make sure you and your partner agree on what the different tags do. - Fix the code so that the second item in each list displays correctly

long_instructions.CSD U2 text style decoration_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that makes the `h1` elements underlined: h1 { text-decoration: underline; } - `h1` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces. The `p` stands for paragraph. - `text-decoration: underline;` is the rule that makes the text inside the `h1` tag underlined. - `text-decoration` is the _property_. It explains what the rule is about, in this case where the line goes. - `underline` is the _value_. It explains how the rule should be applied, in this case making the test underlined. ::: ::: details [**What are the possible values for text decoration?**] You can choose between "underline", "overline", and "line-through". You can read more about the text-decoration property at W3Schools - CSS text-decoration Property ::: ::: details [**Why do I need all the punctuation?**] The punctuation, such as the curly braces `{}`, the colon `:`, and the semicolon `;`, help the computer to understand the rules in the stylesheet. The curly braces hold all the rules for a particular selector. Each rule should end in a semicolon, and the properties and values are always separated by a colon. ::: ::: details [**What is a stylesheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; } In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# Underlining - Find the code in the style sheet that makes the h1 tag underlined. - Change the text decoration and see which one you like. - Choose from "underline", "overline", and "line-through" - Add a text decoration rule for the paragraph or h3 tag.
long_instructions.CSD U2 text style font family_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that is controlling the paragraph font: p { font-family: cursive; } - `p` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces. The `p` stands for paragraph. - `font-family: cursive;` is the rule that makes the text inside the `p` tags a particular font. - `font-family` is the _property_. It explains what the rule is about, in this case the font. - `cursive` is the _value_. It explains how the rule should be applied, in this case making the text cursive. ::: ::: details [**What are the possible values for font family?**] You can choose between "serif", "sans-serif", "cursive", "fantasy", and "monospace". You can also try more specific fonts as described in W3Schools - CSS Web Safe Font Combinations ::: ::: details [**Why do I need all the punctuation?**] The punctuation, such as the curly braces `{}`, the colon `:`, and the semicolon `;`, help the computer to understand the rules in the stylesheet. The curly braces hold all the rules for a particular selector. Each rule should end in a semicolon, and the properties and values are always separated by a colon. ::: ::: details [**What is a stylesheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; } In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# Changing the Font - Find the CSS rule-set in the style sheet that determines the style for the paragraph tag. - Change the font family and choose which one you like the best. - Choose from "serif", "sans-serif", "cursive", "fantasy", and "monospace" - Add a font family rule for the h1 or h3 tags.
long_instructions.CSD U2 text style h1_2019:
::: details [**What colors can I use in CSS?**] CSS includes most common color names (red, blue, green, etc.), and many uncommon ones. You can see a full list of CSS color names at [W3Schools - HTML Color Names](http://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp). You can still use colors that are not included in the named list, but you will need to use their RGB values. You can read more about using colors in CSS at [W3Schools - CSS Legal Color Values](http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css_colors_legal.asp) ::: ::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that is making the `h1` heading red: h1 { color: red; } - `h1` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces. - `color: red;` is the rule that makes the text inside the `h1` tags red. - `color` is the _property_. It explains what the rule is about, in this case the text color. - `red` is the _value_. It explains how the rule should be applied, in this case making the text red. ::: ::: details [**Why do I need all the punctuation?**] The punctuation, such as the curly braces `{}`, the colon `:`, and the semicolon `;`, help the computer to understand the rules in the style sheet. The curly braces hold all the rules for a particular selector. Each rule should end in a semicolon, and the properties and values are always separated by a colon. ::: ::: details [**What is a style sheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; } In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# CSS and Text Color This HTML file uses a style sheet ("style.css") to give the page a particular style. The style sheet contains information about what each of the HTML elements should look like. - Find the code in the style sheet (click on "style.css" in the files list) that is making the h1 heading red. - Change the code for the color of the h1 heading from `red` to a different color.

The selector is the name of the tag you want the rules to be applied to. The rules are a list of property and value pairs. You'll also need to pay careful attention to the punctuation in the rule set. Look at the code below for an example of how the code should look. It explains what the rule is about, in this case the text color. - `red` is the _value_. It explains how the rule should be applied, in this case making the text red. ::: ::: details [**Why do I need all the punctuation?**] The punctuation, such as the curly braces `{}`, the colon `:`, and the semicolon `;`, help the computer to understand the rules in the style sheet. The curly braces hold all the rules for a particular selector. Each rule should end in a semicolon, and the properties and values are always separated by a colon. ::: ::: details [**What is a style sheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property. Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# Making a new CSS rule-set The block of code that gives rules for a particular tag is called a _rule-set_. You can make a new rule set by copying the pattern you see in the rule-set for the `h1` tag. - Find the CSS rule-set in the style sheet that determines the styles for the `h1` tag. - Using the same pattern, write a new CSS rule-set that will determine the style for the `h3` tag. - Add code to set a different color for the `h3` tags.

# Changing text size You can control other things besides colors by using other properties. - Find the CSS rule-set in the style sheet that determines the style for the paragraph tag. - Change the text size of the paragraphs to be bigger. - Add a new rule to your rule-set for your h3 tag to make the text bigger or smaller.
long_instructions.CSD U2 text style text align_2019:
::: details [**How does the code work?**] Here is the code that is controlling the paragraph text alignment: p { text-align: left; } - `p` is the _selector_. It specifies which elements will have to follow the rules inside the curly braces. The `p` stands for paragraph. - `text-align: left;` is the rule that makes the text inside the `p` tags align to the left side of the paragraph. - `text-align` is the _property_. It explains what the rule is about, in this case the text alignment. - `left` is the _value_. It explains how the rule should be applied, in this case making the text align to the left side of the paragraph. ::: ::: details [**Why doesn't text-align: left; do anything?**] Most properties have default values. The default values are the styles that an element will have automatically, before you add your style sheet. The default value for `text-align` is `left`, so it doesn't change from how it already looked. ::: ::: details [**What are the possible values for text align?**] You can choose between "left", "right", and "center". You can read more about the text-align property at W3Schools - CSS text-align Property ::: ::: details [**Why do I need all the punctuation?**] The punctuation, such as the curly braces `{}`, the colon `:`, and the semicolon `;`, help the computer to understand the rules in the style sheet. The curly braces hold all the rules for a particular selector. Each rule should end in a semicolon, and the properties and values are always separated by a colon. ::: ::: details [**What is a style sheet?**] A style sheet is a document that controls how a web page will appear. External style sheets are separate files that are linked to the HTML page. ::: ::: details [**What is CSS?**] CSS is a language that controls the way content on a web site appears. It uses rule-sets to change the look of a page. Each rule set has a selector, which specifies which elements on the page will be affected, and the rules, which explain how to display the elements. Each rule consists of a property and a value for that property.

Here’s an example of a rule-set that makes the text in an `h2` tag blue and cursive: h2 { color: blue; font-family: cursive; } In this example, `h2` is the selector, `color` and `font-family` are properties, and `blue` and `cursive` are the values for those properties. :::
# Text Alignment The `text-align` property sets the horizontal (side to side) position of the text within each line. - Find the "text-align" property in the paragraph tag. - Change the paragraph alignment. - Choose from "left", "right", and "center"

long_instructions.CSD U3 If Else_2019:
# 使用Else的時機

else條件很實用，當你想讓你的程式在條件成立時做一件事情，並且在條件不成立時做另一件事情。

# 執行

按下"執行"可看到一群蜜蜂和在畫面左側有一朵花。設定條件當滑鼠靠近花時讓一群蜜蜂出現（在畫面左側）和當滑鼠離開花時讓一群蜜蜂消失（在畫面右側）。請看右邊的例子。

-   在程式碼中加上 "if else"條件，即可更新蜜蜂的位置
-   使用布林變數輸入條件給if，以判斷當滑鼠的x座標在花的畫面旁邊
-   適當的設定visible參數給每一隻蜜蜂在if及else的條件，讓蜜蜂只在靠近花時出現

long_instructions.CSD U6 analog threshold_2018:
# 改變門檻

預設情況下每次感應器的值改變時就會發出一個"改變"的事件. 但是光線和聲音感應器是持續在變化的, 所以你可能會想要讓"改變"事件變得比較不敏感一點. "門檻"這個屬性讓你設置在何種程度下感應器應該要認為這是一個"改變"事件. 所以設置"聲音感應器.門檻" = 100 將會讓聲音感應器只有在值至少增加或減少100以上才會觸發"改變"事件.

# 作法

這個應用程式會在聲音感應器的值改變時來改變螢幕的背景色, 但是我們想要它只對大音量的改變有反應(像是大聲的噪音). 使用"聲音感應器.門檻"的區塊來調整它.

-   在事件處理器前增加一個"聲音感應器.門檻"的區塊

-   測試不同的門檻值對"改變"事件有什麼影響.

-   選一個門檻值讓只有在感測到大聲噪音的情況下才改變螢幕的背景色.

-   提示: 你的門檻值將會與你房間內周遭的聲音有關, 以及周遭聲音改變的程度. 在安靜房間內能正常運作的門檻值換到嘈雜的教室時不一定有效.

long_instructions.Frequency Analysis:
# 破解隨機替換密碼！

利用 **凱撒加密法** 是很容易被破解的，如果不是利用位移字母，而改成將每個字母隨機對應到不同的字母上呢？這個方法就是 **隨機替換密碼法**。

在這個版本的工具中，透過圖形互動以顯示字母出現頻率。藉由分析比較已加密的訊息中字母出現頻率與一般英文字母出現頻率，你可以縮減字母對照的可能範圍。你知道 _'E'_ 是英文裡最常使用的字母嗎？也許，在你加密過的文字裡，最常出現的字母，就有可能對應至字母 _'E'_。你需要一些猜測的工夫，來確認你的取代規則是否正確。

# 這樣做

-   從下拉式選單內載入 **範例訊息 (困難)** ，這將會載入一個已經被  **隨機替換密碼法** 加密過的訊息。\
    ![](https://images.code.org/04c6230c9607110126581c298bc09183-image-1443569176380.gif)

-   你將會試著猜測每個密文內的字母將被何字母取代，以破解訊息。你可以將藍色的字母直接拖曳到你想要取代的橘色密文字母下方。經由你的猜測而被取代的字母，將不會在左方的視窗內，再被標示為橘色。
    ![](https://images.code.org/da9a7af7568d8c1698872ab91b4d79d7-image-1443572471212.gif)

-   用"隨機替換密碼"選項中提供的一些排序選項，來取得有關輸入字串以及標準英文中字母頻率的不同視圖。
    ![](https://images.code.org/82efbca1807206c9a07de520fdb22027-image-1443572614493.23.28.png)

你花了多久的時間破解這個密碼呢？這是一個加密私密資料的好方法嗎？
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen Change State:
# 改變狀態

現在您能根據程式狀態顯示不同的畫面了，接著您需要在狀態之間切換。為了從「遊戲開始前」("starting") 狀態切換到「遊戲中」("playing") 狀態，可以要求使用者按 "s" 鍵。您 **只** 希望程式在「遊戲開始前」狀態下才檢查這個按鍵，所以這段程式碼應該放在「遊戲開始前」的條件判斷之內。把一個 `if` 區塊放在另一個 `if` 區塊裡稱為 **套疊** (或稱「巢狀」) 條件式。

## 請這麼做

-   在檢查 "starting" 的 `if` 敘述區塊裡，加一組新的 `if` 敘述檢查使用者是否按了 "s" 鍵。 (`if (keyDown("s")) {`)
-   在這個新的 `if` 區塊裡，把 `gameState` 變數設為 "playing"。(`gameState = "playing";`)
-   啟動遊戲然後按 "s" 以測試程式碼。 遊戲應該在按了鍵之後開始運作。

如果遊戲啟動時沒有在啟動畫面的話，請檢查程式開頭建立 `gameState` 變數時，是否有將初始值設為 "starting"。 (`var gameState = "starting";`)
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen Check State:
# 檢查遊戲狀態

現在您把遊戲狀態存到變數裡了，您就能檢查它以判斷應該顯示什麼。這應該發生在描繪迴圈裡，因為這是程式執行過程中會改變的東西。程式應該檢查遊戲是否在「進行中」的狀態，並且只在這個狀態下運作。我們稍後再來煩惱其它狀態。

## 請這麼做

-   在描繪迴圈裡，加一個條件判斷 (`if` 敘述)。
-   判斷內容檢查是否 `gameState == "playing"`。
-   把描繪迴圈內的其餘程式碼移到 `if` 敘述內，讓它們只在遊戲進行中執行。
-   執行程式。應該什麼都不會發生，因為遊戲還在「開始前」(starting)。
-   回到您設定 `gameState` 變數初始值的地方，把 "starting" 改成 "playing"。
-   再次執行遊戲，這次應該能正常運作，因為它現在在「進行中」狀態。
-   把變數初始值改回 "starting"。

(在修改遊戲的過程中，找方法檢查程式運作是很重要的，不要等到做了許多複雜修改之後才試著執行。檢查 "playing" 與 "starting" 狀態之後，您就知道您的判斷式有正常發揮效果，遊戲在 "playing" 的狀態下確實能順利執行。)
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen Check States:
# 檢查所有狀態

現在您的程式能處理的唯一狀態是「遊戲中」("playing")，但您能加入更多判斷式以處理另外三種狀態。

## 請這麼做

-   在描繪迴圈裡，再加入三個 `if` 敘述並讓它們分別檢查 `gameState == "starting"`、`gameState == "won"`、`gameState == "lost"`。
-   在每組 `if` 敘述裡，加入在畫面上顯示訊息的程式碼，讓您能看到不同狀態的結果。您可能也會想用 `drawSprites` 以便看到畫面背景與玩家的角色，但請確定您是把文字畫在 sprite 之上。
-   以不同的狀態執行程式，檢查您的程式碼運作。(先不用把它們寫到完美，只要確定各條件式有正常運作就好。)

為了方便掌握程式碼，您可能會想把每一組不同的文字顯示都放進獨立的函式，然後在條件判斷下面呼叫這些函式。
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen End Game:
# 結束遊戲

接著，您需要加入程式碼，以便在遊戲失敗的時候改變遊戲狀態。捲動到程式最後面 `gameStatus` 函式的部分。在這個函式裡，程式檢查了分數與生命，以判斷使用者是否獲勝或失敗。原本顯示獲勝或失敗訊息的地方，應該改成把遊戲狀態修改為「獲勝」或「失敗」。

## 請這麼做

-   在 `gameStatus` 函式裡，把 `text("You Won!", 35, 200);` 這段程式碼換成 `gameStatus = "won"`。
-   在 `gameStatus` 函式裡，把 `text("You Lost!", 35, 200);` 這段程式碼換成 `gameStatus = "lost"`。
-   啟動遊戲試著失敗，以檢查您的程式碼。
-   啟動遊戲試著獲勝，以檢查您的程式碼。

(要讓遊戲變得非常容易獲勝，可以把生命調成 1000，也就是把 `var lives = 3;` 改成 `var lives = 1000;`。)
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen Hide Sprites:
# 隱藏與顯示 Sprites

您可能會希望平台、硬幣與石頭的 sprites 只在遊戲過程中顯示。您可以修改初始化的程式，在遊戲開始前把它們的可見 (visible) 屬性設為 `false`，並在遊戲開始時才設為 `true`，然後在遊戲獲勝或失敗時再把它們設為 `false`。

## 請這麼做

-   在您建立平台、金幣與石頭 sprites 群組的程式碼之後，新增程式碼將這些 sprite 群組的 visible 屬性設為 `false` (比如說 `platforms.setVisibleEach(false);`)
-   在您設定 `gameState = "playing";` 的三個地方，把這些 sprites 群組的 visible 屬性設為 `true`。
-   在您設定 `gameState = "lost";` 與 `gameState = "won";` 的地方，把這些 sprites 群組的 visible 屬性設為 `false`。
-   啟動遊戲試著失敗、然後再重新開始遊戲，以檢查您的程式碼。
-   啟動遊戲試著獲勝、然後再重新開始遊戲，以檢查您的程式碼。
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen Intro:
# 開始與結束畫面

這個教學會教您如何在 Game Lab 之中建立開始與結束畫面，以及如何從結束畫面重新啟動遊戲。

按左邊的「運行」以開始玩遊戲。跟隨開始畫面的指示操作遊戲。在遊戲結束之後，跟隨結束畫面的指示重新開始遊戲。

您會在下一個泡泡看到遊戲過程的程式碼，並開始加入您自己的開始與結束畫面。

## 開始畫面

開始畫面是在使用者開始玩遊戲之前顯示的介紹畫面。它通常會有遊戲的標題，以及一些基本的操作方法。它可能也會有遊戲開發者的名字。

## 結束畫面

結束畫面會在使用者獲勝或失敗之後顯示。它有時候會顯示最終成績、排名或期他資訊。它也可能會有重玩一次遊戲的選項。
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen Restart Game:
# 重新開始遊戲

最後，您應該想加入讓遊戲重新開始的程式。這跟您一開始讓使用者按 "s" 以開始遊戲的作法很類似，而這次則是要在「獲勝」或「失敗」的狀態下進行檢查。如果使用者在這兩種狀態下按了 "r" 鍵，您就應該重新開始遊戲，也就是把 `gameState` 設成 "playing"，同時也要把 `score` 與 `lives` 變數恢復到遊戲開始時的 0 與 3。

## 請這麼做

-   在 `if (gameState == "lost") {` 區塊下，加一組 `if` 敘述檢查使用者是否按了 "r" 鍵。
-   在這組新的 `if` 敘述下，把 `score` 設為 0、`lives` 設為 3、並把 `gameState` 設成 "playing"。
-   在 `if (gameState == "won") {` 區塊下，加一組 `if` 敘述檢查使用者是否按了 "r" 鍵。
-   在這組新的 `if` 敘述下，把 `score` 設為 0、`lives` 設為 3、並把 `gameState` 設成 "playing"。
-   在 `gameStatus` 函式裡，把 `text("You Lost!", 35, 200);` 這段程式碼換成 `gameState = "lost"`。
-   啟動遊戲試著失敗、然後再重新開始遊戲，以檢查您的程式碼。
-   啟動遊戲試著獲勝、然後再重新開始遊戲，以檢查您的程式碼。
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen State:
# 遊戲狀態變數

我們的範例遊戲有四種我們需要追蹤的不同情景 (或 **狀態**)，以便顯示正確的畫面：「遊戲開始前」(starting)、「遊戲中」(playing)、「獲勝」(won) 與「失敗」(lost)。為遊戲加入開始或結束畫面時，第一個步驟是建立一個變數，以追蹤遊戲狀態的任何變化。

## 請這麼做

-   在程式開頭宣告一個叫做 `gameState` 的變數。 (宣告 `score` 與 `lives` 的位置附近是個適合作這件事的地方)。
-   將您 `gameState` 的初始值設為 "starting"

(因為您還沒真正用上這個變數，所以您會在宣告的地方看到警告三角形。它也還不會影響您的程式運作。)
long_instructions.Gamelab StartScreen base code:
# 遊戲程式碼

這是沒包含開始與結束畫面的遊戲程式碼。`gameStatus` 函式 (在 43 行被呼叫，定義在 208 行) 會檢查使用者是否獲勝或失敗，但它只會在螢幕上多加一段文字。即使已經失敗，遊戲流程還是會繼續下去。

## 請這麼做

閱讀程式碼，特別是描繪迴圈之前 (1-24 行)、描繪迴圈裡 (27-43 行)、`gameStatus` 函式之內 (209-224 行) 的部分。就算您不完全瞭解遊戲流程也沒關係，但您應該看得懂描繪迴圈之前的程式碼準備了 sprites，以及描繪迴圈之中的程式碼控制了遊戲流程。
long_instructions.Intro to Web Lab - Part 1_2019:

long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Automatic DNS:
# Domain Name System (DNS)

在此版本的網路模擬器中，有個網域名稱系統 (DNS) 可以用來查詢所有連接上的電腦的位址。你只能看到其他連上的電腦名稱.\
![](https://images.code.org/3ac2c23ed610abc7e785ec85054e89a9-image-1434746293690.PNG)

DNS 位址將是 \<yourRouterNumber>.15. 利用以下通訊協定來傳送訊息： `GET [hostname]`, 例如: `GET Bob2` 用來取得 Bob2 同學的地址. 並觀察 DNS 分頁中 Note 區的回應訊息.\
![](https://images.code.org/c81c1a6b876eb46674a7f7e5e70506ce-image-1434746797267.png)

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗# Domain Name System (DNS)
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Broadcast:
# 透過網路模擬器傳遞廣播訊息

透過此版本的網路模擬器，你能與同聊天室最多五人連線。當在聊天室送出訊息時，每個人都會收到一樣的訊息。你覺得可能會這系統可能會遇到什麼挑戰，以及如何解決？

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Classroom Routers:
# 訊息路由

透過此版本的網路模擬器，每個人連上路由器並且會有個專屬位址。送訊息時需要指定收件人位址，路由器便能傳遞到對的電腦。如果有其他新增加的路由器，問同學他的電腦的位址並且送個訊息！透過觀察路由器的紀錄來了解訊息是如何傳遞在網路上的。

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Freeplay:
# 網路模擬器 - 自由練習

此版本的網路模擬器中，大多數的參數可以被調整與設定。可以送訊息給其他同學，以及訊息會經過不同的路線到達目的地。

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Manual DNS:
# 網域名稱系統 (DNS) 簡介

在此版本的網路模擬器將無法看到其他同學的位址。取而代之的是你們其中之一要擔任網域名稱伺服器，用來分享位址。從左行 DNS 分頁中，其中一人可以接管擔任 DNS 的角色。

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Packets TCP:
＃封包以及可靠網路的組成

網路上的訊息會經過許多不同的路徑到達到目的地，有時訊息可能會掉。在這個版本的網路模擬器：

-   約有 10% 機率會掉封包
-   封包可能會走不同的路徑到目的地
-   預設最大封包大小為 6 個字元

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone SendAB:
# 利用網路模擬器送出位元訊號

你跟同學共享一條只能表現兩種狀態的線路 － A 或 B 狀態 。你能在任意時間設定線路狀態，或能在任意時間讀取線路狀態。你能想到在這樣的系統中，如何才能有效率的通訊嗎？

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Sending Numbers:
# 透過網路模擬器傳遞數字

你跟同學可以不需要協調來可靠的來回傳遞訊息了！能來回的傳遞位元組，也能利用位元組來代表十進位數字。你覺得我們可以透過這個系統，可以用來傳遞什麼樣的訊息呢？

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.NetSim Standalone Sending Numbers Ascii:
# 透過網路模擬器傳遞文字訊息

你現在能傳遞十進位數字了，接著你能對應數字到字母來回的傳遞文字訊息。透過文字的通訊協定，便能簡單的表達各種類型的訊息。

老師將會給出相關的操作步驟以完成這個實驗
long_instructions.Pixelation - Lesson 15 - Color Shades: # 色彩像素化: 工作2 **指示:** 我們讓您從 Maddie 在影片裡製作的兩列紅色漸層開始。請試著在影像底部那列填上另一個顏色的漸層來實驗 6-bit 色彩。這邊以藍色舉例。請嘗試您自選的顏色！
long_instructions.Pixelation - Lesson 15 - Color Shades 4x: # 像素化: 工作 3 **指示:** 我們讓您從 Maddie 在影片裡建立的 4x4 影像開始。 您的工作是在 4x4 的表格之中以 _每像素 12-bits 的格式_ 填上顏色。結果看起來應該很像右邊那張影像 (但不會完全相同)。 下面是需求: - 第一列 - 填入紅色漸層。 - 第二列 - 綠色漸層。 - 第三列 - 藍色漸層。 - 第四列 - 灰色漸層。
long_instructions.Pixelation - Lesson 15 - Complete 3-bit:
# 色彩像素化: 工作 1

**指示:**

-   我們讓您從 Maddie 正在製作的 4x2 影像開始，不過我們留了最後兩個方塊沒做。
-   請想想最後漏掉的是哪兩個顏色，寫出編碼以完成這張影像。
long_instructions.Pixelation 4x4 Empty: 長與寬都在這塊像素資料中被加密了，你可以想出要如何才能調整維度嗎？
long_instructions.Pixelation Bee:
# 每像素 12 bits 的範例

-   這張比較大的蜜蜂影像以每個像素 12 bits 編碼色彩，而以十六進位格式來檢視內容會比較容易看出每個像素的色彩。
-   如果您切換到二進位模式 - 請壓好您的帽子 - 就會看到很多 bits。
-   然後還有一個嚇人的事情可以試試: 把每個像素的 bits 調成 24 看看。會發生什麼事？您能解釋這個現象嗎？
long_instructions.Pixelation Flappy:
# 每個像素更多 bits 的範例

這邊是一張比較大的影像，每個像素 9 bits。每個像素有 9 bits 讓您能表現 512 種不同的顏色。點按之後可以看到另一張影像，內容更複雜，但應該比較容易理解。
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 1: # 設置密室 為了製作密室逃脫，你需要設置一個使用者有辦法到處探險的房間。有些事情已經幫你做完了。你只需要挑選圖片，決定房間的不同部分該長怎樣。 # 做這個 - 這個階段以設計模式開始。 - 給每一個空白的圖片元件（灰色長方形）加一個適當的圖片。例如你需要給標示為門的的圖片元件一個門的圖片。 - 右邊是密室可能的長相範例。
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 10: # 開門 差不多了！讓我們把門設定好，準備把它打開。 # 請這麼做 - 新增門外的圖片 - 給它一個好 ID (比如說 _outside_) - 隱藏門外的圖片 (這會在開門之後才顯示)
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 10 - 2: # 開門 當使用者有鑰匙的時候，把門打開！ # 請這麼做 - 新增一個 `onEvent` 積木，處理點按門的事件 - 在這個 `onEvent` 區塊裡新增一個 `if` 敘述，檢查鑰匙的位置是否移到螢幕底部 - 新增一個 `if` 敘述 - 在 if 敘述裡加一個 `==` - 在 `==` 的其中一邊，填入您在點按鑰匙後，鑰匙移動到的 x 位置 - 在 `==` 的另一邊新增 `getXPosition()` 積木 - 傳給它的 ID 必須是您為鑰匙設定的 ID！ - 在 `if` 敘的區塊裡，用 `showElement` 在使用者擁有鑰匙的時候顯示一開始被隱藏的門外圖片
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 3: # 隱藏代碼 1. 在設計模式下，點選顯示「CODE」的白色方塊後，將文字更改成你自行選擇的神秘代碼。 2. 將圖片向下拖曳蓋住神秘代碼
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 3-2:
# 移動圖片

接著讓使用者可以點選圖片以得知神秘代碼。當使用者點選圖片的時候，圖片應該往上移動、離開遮擋位置。

## 請這麼做

-   拉出一個 `onEvent` 積木
-   把 `onEvent` 的 ID 欄位改成圖片 (也就是圖片元素的 ID)
-   在 `onEvent` 裡面加一個 `setPosition` 積木，填入以下輸入
    -   ID: 圖片
    -   之後兩個輸入是 x, y 座標值 - 嘗試一些數字，讓圖片仿照右邊圖片的範例移動
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 4: # 設定保險箱 您現在有了一組神秘代碼，讓使用者可以前進到第二間房間了。讓我們賦予使用者點按保險箱之後輸入神秘代碼的能力。 # 請這麼做 - 新增一個 `onEvent` 積木 - 選擇保險箱的 ID - 在 `onEvent` 的積木裡加一個 積木 - 在左邊把 _x_ (變數的名稱) 設為 _guess_ - 在右邊把 _"Enter a value"_ (對使用者提示的文字) 改成 _"Enter the code"_ (輸入代碼)。
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 5: # 檢查神秘代碼 現在您得到使用者猜測的一組神秘代碼，接著就要檢查猜得對不對！我們可以用 `if` 敘述辦到這件事。`if` 敘述判斷一組條件式是否為真，這邊我們要判斷的是使用者輸入的數字是否等於神秘代碼。 # 請這麼做 - 在保險箱的 `onEvent` 積木區塊內、提示訊息之後，新增一組 敘述 - 拉出 區塊以建立條件式，判斷兩個東西是否相等 - 在 的其中一邊填入 _guess_ (我們儲存使用者猜測值的變數名稱) - 另一邊則填上您的神秘代碼的變數名稱
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 7: # 顯示保險箱內容 一旦您檢查神秘代碼的程式能順利運作，接著您應該會想「打開」保險箱、揭露裡面放置的鑰匙。首先要在設計模式建立這些元素。 # 請這麼做 - 切到設計模式，新增一個灰色方形影像 - 點選並拖拉一個影像元素 到畫面上 - 給它一個好 ID (像是 _insideSafe_) - 找一張灰色方形圖片來用 - 這會成為保險箱的背板，顯示的時候遮住保險箱後面的東西 - 新增一個鑰匙影像 - 點選並拖拉一個影像元素 到畫面上 - 給它一個好 ID (像是 _key_) - 找一張鑰匙的圖片來用 - 在設計模式裡點按灰色方形與鑰匙圖片的 hidden (隱藏) 屬性。當它們被隱藏的時候，在設計模式看起來會類似這樣
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 8:
# 顯示保險箱裡面

接著來寫一段程式碼，在使用者輸入正確代碼的時候顯示鑰匙與灰色方塊。

# 請這麼做

-   在您為保險箱的 `onEvent` 指令建立的  `if` 敘述下，新增：
    -   顯示灰色方塊的 `showElement` 積木
    -   顯示鑰匙的 `showElement` 積木
long_instructions.Room Escape Workshop - 9-2: # 點按鑰匙 在使用者點按鑰匙之後，您會想顯示它們拿著鑰匙。您可以把鑰匙移到房間的底部角落以表達這件事。 # 請這麼做 - 新增一個 `onEvent` 積木，處理使用者點按鑰匙的動作。 - 在 `onEvent` 區塊內: - 用 `setPosition` 把鑰匙移到畫面底部角落

long_instructions.Vigenere:
# 使用維吉尼亞密碼對訊息進行加密和解密

這是維吉尼亞密碼的互動式版本，可對加密和解密進行動畫處理，並提供一段要加密或解密的文字和密鑰。

# 動手做

### 加密訊息

單擊“步驟”幾次，然後跟踪發生的情況.注意:

-   密文是如何產生的
-   當您取得最後一個字符時會發生什麼
-   逐步瀏覽完幾個字符後，點擊播放以觀看其餘的動畫
-   單擊重新啟動，然後再次播放動畫。您可以使用速度條來加快或降低速度  

![](https://images.code.org/06858f88ac12997bba73f4f76638a068-image-1443574425185.gif)

### 解密訊息

如上所述加密訊息,然後:  

-   突出顯示並複製密文
-   將其黏貼到純文字區域.注意:請勿更改密鑰
-   將“加密/解密”開關更改為“解密”
-   連按幾次“步驟”，然後播放

您應該會看到原始文字.\
![](https://images.code.org/dc89d6c19c17adb23b6b5ff9a62c4583-image-1443574425182.gif)

破解使用此密碼加密的消息有多困難？鑰匙的長度是否有所不同?

long_instructions.outbreak2:
# 事件程式設計
_ 噢！其中一個怪物感染了病毒！當健康的怪物接觸生病的怪物時，它也會生病。_
為了讓兩個精靈圖接觸時發生一些事件，我們將使用這個“事件”塊： [blockly block][0] 請注意，你可以使用左側的藍色“+”打開這個塊。 ## 這樣做 使用裡面的“主題”塊，在當它們接觸時將**健康怪物** [][1]變成**生病怪物** [][2]。
long_instructions.outbreak4: # 更多怪物 _新的怪物正在進入怪物鎮！這對疫情爆發意味著什麼？讓我們使用模擬來進行預測。_ ## 這樣做 1. 通過編輯這個塊來改變你創建的怪物精靈圖的數量： [blockly block][0] 2. 通過編輯這個塊來改變精靈圖的大小： [blockly block][1] 3. 運行新的模擬3-5次。 _發生了什麼不同的事情嗎？_
long_instructions.outbreak5:
# 恢復
_好消息：怪物可以自己好轉了！開始恢復的生病怪物將在一段時間後自動變回一個健康的怪物。讓我們在模擬中添加代碼，讓所有生病的怪物逐漸從病毒中恢復過來。_
我們現在有一個特殊的[blockly block][0]行為。你可以在怪物感染病毒的任何時候把它添加到你的代碼中。 ## 做這個 1. 在你的“接觸時”事件下，添加更多代碼使主題精靈圖開始“恢復”行為。 [blockly block][1]
long_instructions.outbreak6:
# 幾率
_現在，如果有怪物戴著口罩，就不可能傳播或感染病毒。這聽起來很棒，但實際上並沒有那麼簡單。我們應該添加一個讓病毒在任何兩個怪物接觸時傳播的“幾率”（或概率）。我們可以按照下面的說明模擬感染病毒的幾率。_
說明：口罩如何影響怪物鎮疫情爆發

_口罩的好處_ | 健康 | 生病 | 幾率 | % | | :---: | :---: | :-----: | :-: | | [][6] | [][7] | **非常高** | 90% | | [][4] | [][5] | **高** | 75% | | [][2] | [][3] | **低** | 25% | | [][0] | [][1] | **非常低** | 10% |

## 這樣做 1. 在“接觸時”事件下添加這個**邏輯**塊，並將其設置為一個非常高的幾率： [blockly block][8] 2. 添加更多的事件，包括怪物戴口罩，並給每個怪物不同的百分比（概率）。如果不確定需要哪些事件，請點擊燈泡獲取提示。 3. 當你準備好繼續前進時，按**完成**。
long_instructions.outbreak7:
# 疫苗
_疫苗可以保護怪物免受病毒感染。這些怪物根本不會生病！_
接下來，你將創建一個新的精靈圖服裝來代表接種過疫苗的怪物。
學習如何修改精靈圖服裝。 | | 修改服裝： | | --------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | [expandable][0]
（點擊查看） | 1. 切換到左上角的服裝標籤。
2. 複製一個現有的服裝。
3. 為繪圖選擇一個基本顏色。
4. 點擊顏料桶工具，然後點擊怪物的身體為它重新著色。 |
一旦新服裝準備就緒，想辦法把它融入到你的程式中。例如，你可以在戴口罩怪物被點擊時將其更改為接種過疫苗的怪物。
long_instructions.outbreak8:
# 分享你的資訊！
_你可以與世界分享你的創作和你的資訊！你從這個活動中學到了什麼？你希望別人能學到什麼？_
[blockly block][0]塊將在模擬運行時在螢幕上顯示文本。使用它來告訴用戶你的模擬如何運行或分享資訊。 下面是一些例子： [blockly block][1] [blockly block][2]
long_instructions.outbreak1:
# 創建一個模擬
_今天，你將編寫代碼，這樣你就可以在怪物鎮運行你自己的類比病毒爆發。_ _首先，我們將通過創建精靈圖來代表怪物，讓怪物鎮變得充滿生機。在**工作區**寫代碼，然後按_ **運行** _查看你的模擬。如果你需要任何説明，請點擊_ **燈泡**獲取提示。\_
## 這樣做 1. 製作精靈圖來代表10個健康的怪物[][0]和1個生病的怪物[][1]。**精靈圖**是螢幕上可以移動、改變或交互的角色。 2. 將精靈圖的大小設置為“50”，並讓它們開始“漫步”。 3. 點擊“運行”。 你應該會看到精靈圖像動畫一樣向右移動。
long_instructions.outbreak3: # 用口罩阻止疫情爆發 _減緩疫情爆發的一種方法是戴口罩。戴口罩的怪物將無法感染病毒或將其傳染給他人。為了在一個類型的怪物被點擊時發生某種事件，你可以使用一個新的_ "事件" _塊類型。_ ## 這樣做 1. 使用“點擊時”塊和“更改服裝”塊，在健康的怪物被點擊時給它們戴口罩。對生病的怪物重複此步驟。 2. 按“運行”並開始快速點擊怪物。試著通過給所有怪物戴口罩來減緩或阻止疫情爆發。

"新增更多的東西，讓這個遊戲變得更有趣！

1.  設定騎士碰到飛龍的時候消失。   
2.  在他們相撞時播放聲音，使其感覺更真實。   

* * *

造訪所有的目標，然後撞到龍就可以過關。"
long_instructions.courseB_playlab_eventsFP_2021: **自由發揮：** 發揮你的想像力，想想要怎麼樣讓遊戲更有趣？
long_instructions.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_2021:
是時候舉行動物大賽跑了！當您按「▼」時，讓動物們往下移動。

誰會是跑得最快的？
long_instructions.courseB_playlab_events_challenge2_2021:
讓我們在點擊動物時，讓它們消失。
現在嘗試與狗玩遊戲，然後幫助其他動物加入遊戲。您也可以添加音效和獲取積分來創建一個動物標籤遊戲！

![](https://images.code.org/d48437a0b08be90110541e0ef21076e0-image-1497907722000.gif)
long_instructions.courseB_starWars_prog1_2021:
![Rey](https://images.code.org/51347264025d71343bb2b5bd6b49813b-image-1500569514703.png)_「去收集所有的廢金屬，BB-8！」_ 

請小心墻壁和箱子。廢金屬是這樣的：![picture of scrap metal](https://images.code.org/5665566ab779d9b63d03cf8ba127a98f-image-1500570606896.gif)
long_instructions.courseB_starWars_prog8_2021:
![](https://images.code.org/51347264025d71343bb2b5bd6b49813b-image-1500569514703.png) _「繼續努力，BB-8。」_

**挑戰**：收集所有的廢金屬。
long_instructions.courseC19_playLab_EOC1_2021:
你學到了這麼多東西，真是太神奇了！讓我們一步一步來進行遊戲。

在工具箱中使用新的積木，選擇新的背景，然後挑選一名角色加入你的遊戲。
long_instructions.courseC19_playLab_EOC2_2021:
當你按下方向鍵時，使用事件和活動讓你的角色移動。

向4個方向移動行動者3秒鐘以完成級別。
long_instructions.courseC19_playLab_EOC3_2021:
讓我們在遊戲中添加更多角色吧！

使用`設定角色`積木添加更多角色，然後將角色移動至目標後，即可完成此關卡。
long_instructions.courseC19_playLab_EOC4_2021:
"設定多個角色並使角色移動是遊戲的一個很好的開始，但是我們需要做更多的事情才能使它看起來像真實的遊戲。讓我們新增一個分數吧！

使用諸如`當角色碰到`等事件積木來更改分數。得分 5 分或贏得比賽，即可完成這個關卡。"
long_instructions.courseC19_playLab_EOC5_2021: 現在花些時間確保遊戲按照你想要的方式運作。包括輸或贏的方式，還有滿足的條件設定。
long_instructions.courseC19_playLab_EOC6_2021: 完成啦！現在，你可以開始遊玩或與你的朋友一起分享了！
long_instructions.courseC_PlayLab_events6_2021: 現在，編寫一個程式，用向上/向下/向左/向右鍵操縱企鵝擊中所有目標！
long_instructions.courseC_PlayLab_events7_2021:
`重複無限次`積木可以用來不斷地運行程式碼。使用此積木可讓恐龍（角色 2）不停地上下移動 400 像素。

![](https://images.code.org/0cbe6dd5f4e2251e3f121dbabc0cc19d-image-1523040103822.com-resize.gif)
long_instructions.courseC_PlayLab_events8_2021:
如果企鵝（角色 1）遇到了恐龍，你可以讓它發出「撞到」的聲音並說「哎喲！」嗎？

編寫完成後，進行遊戲來實現這一目標。

![](https://images.code.org/a634f249021651f60a1acf37bf78d07d-image-1475342557950.gif)
long_instructions.courseC_PlayLab_eventsA_embed_2021: 我們來玩個遊戲吧。將企鵝移動到章魚上，就能得到 1 分。取得 5 分就能贏。
long_instructions.courseC_PlayLab_events_challenge1_2021:
"使用新的積木，使企鵝碰到恐龍並且得分時自動回到起點。這將使你的遊戲更具挑戰性和樂趣！

開始遊戲並用箭頭鍵移動企鵝，直到獲得 5 分或更高的分數。必須將企鵝移至畫面的`左中`位置才能完成此挑戰。"
long_instructions.courseC_artist_loops1a_2021:
"**自由發揮：**讓我們來建造一個更大的東西，一步一步來！

用 <xml> <block type="jump_to" block-text="jump to the middle center position"><title name="VALUE">13</title></block></xml> 積木把小藝術家弄到遊戲區的中心，然後用 <xml><block type="sticker" block-text="draw sticker"><title name="VALUE">Beaver</title></block></xml> 積木把東西畫出來。

* * *

當你對自己製作的東西感到滿意時，按「完成」來完成。

"在程式碼中新增一個`轉向`命令來改變你的貼紙的方向。

當你對自己製作的東西感到滿意時，按「完成」來完成。

long_instructions.courseC_artist_loops2a_2021:

* * *

當你對自己製作的東西感到滿意時，按「完成」來完成。

long_instructions.courseC_artist_loops3a_2021:

現在，在第一個貼紙的上面再加上第二個貼紙，就可以做出一個像下面這樣的圖片。

當你對自己製作的東西感到滿意時，按「完成」來完成。

![expandable](https://images.code.org/3aa37f679eabc7a5a337291db614dd98-image-1496711069351.03.49.png)

long_instructions.courseC_artist_loops4a_2021:
"編輯你的程式碼，讓你在畫兩個貼紙之間向前跳躍。在這個關卡中，確保在你的迴圈裡面有`跳到中間的中心位置`，這樣你才能保持在中心位置！

* * *

當你對自己製作的東西感到滿意時，按「完成」來完成。

long_instructions.courseC_artist_loops5b_2021:
"當你在迴圈內某處`移動 - 向前`，然後`移動 - 向後` 100、200 或 400 像素會發生什麼？  

-   試著在開始迴圈之前使用`設定圖案`積木來製作一個藝術作品吧！

"在迴圈中的任何地方新增第三張貼紙！現在是什麼樣子？

-   改變你的畫筆上的圖案，讓你的畫筆變得更豐富！

* * *

![expandable](https://images.code.org/edc53f27379e018e61a6ab9dcc2717ea-image-1560984648573.png)

long_instructions.courseC_artist_loops7a_2021:
"試著改變`重複`迴圈執行不同的次數。  你要轉多少次才能繞一整圈？

-   試著改變你旋轉的次數
    -   試著來個 60 度轉彎，轉 6 圈
    -   試著來個 20 度轉彎，轉 18 圈

* * *

第一張圖用了一個海盜、一個忍者和一隻長頸鹿。它們以 20 度的轉角迴圈 18 次。
